Description: Neck and body sherd (mended from three fragments with added plaster) of Attic black-figured pottery olpe; interior: glazed streaky black on neck, reserved below; exterior: top of neck glazed; panel below with single line at top; in panel, black-figure decoration consisting of lion to right (head with added red on mane, stripe around muzzle, eye and tongue remaining); at right, part of outspread wing of swan or siren with red; incised splinter rosette with red dots as fillng ornament.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B102.22)
Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 254, no. 3)
Beazley 1944 / Groups of Early Attic Black Figure (p. 42, no. 11)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 301, no. B297)
Venit 1984 / Early Attic Black Figure Vases in Egypt (p. 144, note 24, no. 7)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 224, no. 9a, b)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0299) (Phase 1)
